thread.title: SEC Softball Tournament weather updates: Thursday's games delayed by weather
thread.title_full: SEC Softball Tournament weather updates: Thursday's games delayed by weather

author: , Gainesville Sun
title: SEC Softball Tournament weather updates: Thursday's games delayed by weather
text: The 2024 SEC Softball Tournament was delayed Thursday at Auburn's Jane B. Moore Field due to inclement weather. The quarterfinal round of the tournament was scheduled to begin at 11 a.m. CT, but the SEC posted on X (formerly known as Twitter) at 10:24 a.m. that it would be going into a rain delay. At 10:55 a.m., the account said they were under an "extended delay . The Tennessee Vols X account called the delay an "indefinite rain delay" and that the next update would come at 1 p.m. CT. LSU-Tennessee will be played at 5 p.m. Thursday, followed by Missouri-Arkansas 35 minutes after the conclusion of that game. Florida-Georgia will be played at 9 a.m. Friday, with Texas A&M and South Carolina following it up 35 minutes after.Here’s what you need to know about the SEC softball schedule and the latest updates: REQUIRED READING: SEC Softball Tournament bracket: Full TV schedule, scores, results for 2024 championship [SEC Tournament softball weather updates] 1:05 p.m.: The SEC social media account tweeted out a revised schedule for the quarterfinal. Tennessee-LSU will play at 5 p.m. CT, followed by Missouri-Arkansas 35 minutes following the conclusion of the first game. Florida-Georgia will be moved to Friday morning, with a 9 a.m. first pitch. Texas A&M and South Carolina will play 35 minutes following the conclusion of that one. 12:53 p.m.: At 12:50 p.m. CT, the LSU softball account tweeted that the first pitch of the Tennessee-LSU game is now scheduled for 5 p.m. CT. With three other games scheduled behind the quarterfinal opener, it will be interesting to see how the schedule plays out. 12:01 p.m.: The SEC Softball Tournament remains in an "extended weather delay", per the SEC social media account. There are no updates yet about a potential start time. SEC softball tournament schedule for quarterfinals The 2024 SEC Tournament got underway Tuesday with No. 13 seed Ole Miss beating No. 12 Kentucky 7-2. Four games were played in the second round Wednesday, including 14-inning victories for 8 seed LSU over 9 seed Alabama and 7 seed Georgia over 10 seed Auburn. Tennessee, which is the No. 1 overall seed and the defending champion, was scheduled to open the day against LSU at 11 a.m. Here's a look at the rest of the scheduled games for the rest of the day: - Game 6: No. 1 Tennessee vs. No. 8 LSU | 5 p.m. | SEC Network - Game 7: No. 4 Arkansas vs. No. 5 Missouri – approx. 35 minutes following Game 6 | SEC Network - Game 8: No. 2 Florida vs. No. 7 Georgia – 9 a.m., Friday | SEC Network - Game 9: No. 3 Texas A&M vs. No. 11 South Carolina – approx. 35 minutes following Game 8 | SEC Network The semifinals are scheduled to begin at 4 p.m. Friday, and the championship game is scheduled for 5 p.m. Saturday.
